alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:48PM MST until December 26 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN COLORADO MOUNTAINS... .A cold front moving across the mountains was bringing strong winds and considerable blowing snow along with a quick shot of heavy snow across the northern Colorado mountains this afternoon. There will be near blizzard conditions at times and road closures will be possible. The worst of the snow and winds will be past by this evening, though lighter snow and windy conditions will continue over the higher mountains overnight. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph producing areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...North Park, and Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org
